summary: Email chain regarding arrangements for Ghislaine Maxwell's custody at Merrimack DOC, focusing on adding her New York attorneys to her approved contact list and detailing strict security protocols. The correspondence involves US Marshals and legal representatives coordinating attorney-client communication.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the custody arrangements, housed at Merrimack DOC under strict monitoring as a high-profile inmate.

persons.name: Chris Everdell
persons.context: One of Maxwell's New York attorneys from Cohen & Gresser LLP whom the sender seeks to add to the approved contact list for phone calls.

persons.name: Mark Cohen
persons.context: One of Maxwell's New York attorneys from Cohen & Gresser LLP whom the sender seeks to add to the approved contact list for phone calls.

persons.name: Lawrence Vogelman
persons.context: Attorney already on Maxwell's approved contact list, authorized to communicate with her after providing a PIN.

connections.description: Everdell is one of Maxwell's New York attorneys whom she is authorized to call, as per the email request to add him to the contact list.
Cohen is one of Maxwell's New York attorneys whom she is authorized to call, as per the email request to add him to the contact list.
Vogelman is already on the approved list as Maxwell's legal counsel, authorized for contact with a PIN.
Both are partners at the same law firm, Cohen & Gresser LLP, representing Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Coordination for Attorney Contact Addition
events.description: Email exchange to add Maxwell's New York attorneys (Chris Everdell and Mark Cohen) to her approved phone contact list at Merrimack DOC.

events.title: Custody Restrictions Issued
events.description: USMS issues strict custody protocols for Ghislaine Maxwell at Merrimack DOC, including housing in medical, SRT guards, 15-minute watches, and limited attorney contact.

events.title: Documentation Delivery Deadline
events.description: Supervisors are directed to deliver downloaded touch probe rounds and camera footage from Maxwell's cell to a specified recipient.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was in custody at Merrimack DOC under extremely strict security protocols, including housing in a medical cell, 15-minute observation watches, and SRT personnel guard.

Her approved attorney contact initially only included Lawrence Vogelman, but her legal team requested adding New York attorneys Chris Everdell and Mark Cohen (partners at Cohen & Gresser LLP) to facilitate case discussions.
All staff were prohibited from conversing with Maxwell outside health/safety matters and from making statements to the press, emphasizing the high-profile nature of the case.
Video footage from Maxwell's cell DVR was to be downloaded daily onto a USB drive and tracked via a designated form, indicating rigorous monitoring and documentation.
The email chain shows coordination between US Marshals and legal representatives to ensure attorney-client communication while maintaining tight custody controls.
